<Link id="l00392" /><CodeLine lineNumber="392"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="#a3b12f6c109442edaa63ab03ba8a6caec">hasher&#95;init&#95;base</a>(self, context&#95;key&#95;words, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/lib/support/blake3/blake3-impl-h/#af1f12c808c513e84d39a88930812b5cba399b62381341913e02639d8e1d3e8744">DERIVE&#95;KEY&#95;MATERIAL</a>);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00393" /><CodeLine lineNumber="393"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00394" /><CodeLine lineNumber="394"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00395" /><CodeLine lineNumber="395" lineLink="#ad0b8fa0cf17c5aa764845fbd3739c85b"><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="#ad0b8fa0cf17c5aa764845fbd3739c85b">llvm&#95;blake3&#95;hasher&#95;init&#95;derive&#95;key</a>(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/lib/support/blake3/llvm-blake3-prefix-h/#a720ce7ad2dc122aeb214c6a5d4731f46">blake3&#95;hasher</a> &#42;self, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">char</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &#42;context) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00396" /><CodeLine lineNumber="396"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="#acf30a68b4c258e1c1af255c60e880aac">llvm&#95;blake3&#95;hasher&#95;init&#95;derive&#95;key&#95;raw</a>(self, context, strlen(context));</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00397" /><CodeLine lineNumber="397"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00398" /><CodeLine lineNumber="398"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00399" /><CodeLine lineNumber="399"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// As described in hasher&#95;push&#95;cv() below, we do &quot;lazy merging&quot;, delaying</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00400" /><CodeLine lineNumber="400"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// merges until right before the next CV is about to be added. This is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00401" /><CodeLine lineNumber="401"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// different from the reference implementation. Another difference is that we</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00402" /><CodeLine lineNumber="402"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// aren&#39;t always merging 1 chunk at a time. Instead, each CV might represent</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00403" /><CodeLine lineNumber="403"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// any power-of-two number of chunks, as long as the smaller-above-larger stack</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00404" /><CodeLine lineNumber="404"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// order is maintained. Instead of the &quot;count the trailing 0-bits&quot; algorithm</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00405" /><CodeLine lineNumber="405"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// described in the spec, we use a &quot;count the total number of 1-bits&quot; variant</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00406" /><CodeLine lineNumber="406"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// that doesn&#39;t require us to retain the subtree size of the CV on top of the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00407" /><CodeLine lineNumber="407"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// stack. The principle is the same: each CV that should remain in the stack is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00408" /><CodeLine lineNumber="408"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// represented by a 1-bit in the total number of chunks (or bytes) so far.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00409" /><CodeLine lineNumber="409" lineLink="#a63183e27546bc2e072233e0268400e83"><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/lib/support/blake3/blake3-impl-h/#a2eb6f9e0395b47b8d5e3eeae4fe0c116">INLINE</a> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="#a63183e27546bc2e072233e0268400e83">hasher&#95;merge&#95;cv&#95;stack</a>(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/lib/support/blake3/llvm-blake3-prefix-h/#a720ce7ad2dc122aeb214c6a5d4731f46">blake3&#95;hasher</a> &#42;self, uint64&#95;t total&#95;len) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00410" /><CodeLine lineNumber="410"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">size&#95;t</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> post&#95;merge&#95;stack&#95;len = (size&#95;t)<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/lib/support/blake3/blake3-impl-h/#a1817d7ef688b133f9befd300d9e971a0">popcnt</a>(total&#95;len);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00411" /><CodeLine lineNumber="411"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">while</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (self-&gt;cv&#95;stack&#95;len &gt; post&#95;merge&#95;stack&#95;len) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00412" /><CodeLine lineNumber="412"><span class="doxyHighlight">    uint8&#95;t &#42;parent&#95;node =</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00413" /><CodeLine lineNumber="413"><span class="doxyHighlight">        &amp;self-&gt;cv&#95;stack&#91;(self-&gt;cv&#95;stack&#95;len - 2) &#42; <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/lib/support/blake3/llvm-blake3-prefix-h/#a54e230beb5e1d501702361fb91f399f0">BLAKE3&#95;OUT&#95;LEN</a>&#93;;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00414" /><CodeLine lineNumber="414"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/structs/output-t">output&#95;t</a> output = <a href="#ab18874614dade172d2726abc3e88d480">parent&#95;output</a>(parent&#95;node, self-&gt;key, self-&gt;chunk.flags);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00415" /><CodeLine lineNumber="415"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="#a92376f69320e66a51477df2b47088249">output&#95;chaining&#95;value</a>(&amp;output, parent&#95;node);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00416" /><CodeLine lineNumber="416"><span class="doxyHighlight">    self-&gt;cv&#95;stack&#95;len -= 1;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00417" /><CodeLine lineNumber="417"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00418" /><CodeLine lineNumber="418"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00419" /><CodeLine lineNumber="419"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00420" /><CodeLine lineNumber="420"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// In reference&#95;impl.rs, we merge the new CV with existing CVs from the stack</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00421" /><CodeLine lineNumber="421"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// before pushing it. We can do that because we know more input is coming, so</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00422" /><CodeLine lineNumber="422"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// we know none of the merges are root.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00423" /><CodeLine lineNumber="423"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00424" /><CodeLine lineNumber="424"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// This setting is different. We want to feed as much input as possible to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00425" /><CodeLine lineNumber="425"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// compress&#95;subtree&#95;wide(), without setting aside anything for the chunk&#95;state.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00426" /><CodeLine lineNumber="426"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// If the user gives us 64 KiB, we want to parallelize over all 64 KiB at once</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00427" /><CodeLine lineNumber="427"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// as a single subtree, if at all possible.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00428" /><CodeLine lineNumber="428"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00429" /><CodeLine lineNumber="429"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// This leads to two problems:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00430" /><CodeLine lineNumber="430"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// 1) This 64 KiB input might be the only call that ever gets made to update.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00431" /><CodeLine lineNumber="431"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    In this case, the root node of the 64 KiB subtree would be the root node</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00432" /><CodeLine lineNumber="432"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    of the whole tree, and it would need to be ROOT finalized. We can&#39;t</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00433" /><CodeLine lineNumber="433"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    compress it until we know.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00434" /><CodeLine lineNumber="434"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// 2) This 64 KiB input might complete a larger tree, whose root node is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00435" /><CodeLine lineNumber="435"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    similarly going to be the the root of the whole tree. For example, maybe</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00436" /><CodeLine lineNumber="436"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    we have 196 KiB (that is, 128 + 64) hashed so far. We can&#39;t compress the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00437" /><CodeLine lineNumber="437"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    node at the root of the 256 KiB subtree until we know how to finalize it.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00438" /><CodeLine lineNumber="438"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00439" /><CodeLine lineNumber="439"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The second problem is solved with &quot;lazy merging&quot;. That is, when we&#39;re about</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00440" /><CodeLine lineNumber="440"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// to add a CV to the stack, we don&#39;t merge it with anything first, as the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00441" /><CodeLine lineNumber="441"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// reference impl does. Instead we do merges using the &#42;previous&#42; CV that was</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00442" /><CodeLine lineNumber="442"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// added, which is sitting on top of the stack, and we put the new CV</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00443" /><CodeLine lineNumber="443"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// (unmerged) on top of the stack afterwards. This guarantees that we never</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00444" /><CodeLine lineNumber="444"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// merge the root node until finalize().</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00445" /><CodeLine lineNumber="445"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00446" /><CodeLine lineNumber="446"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Solving the first problem requires an additional tool,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00447" /><CodeLine lineNumber="447"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// compress&#95;subtree&#95;to&#95;parent&#95;node(). That function always returns the top</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00448" /><CodeLine lineNumber="448"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// &#42;two&#42; chaining values of the subtree it&#39;s compressing. We then do lazy</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00449" /><CodeLine lineNumber="449"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// merging with each of them separately, so that the second CV will always</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00450" /><CodeLine lineNumber="450"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// remain unmerged. (That also helps us support extendable output when we&#39;re</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00451" /><CodeLine lineNumber="451"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// hashing an input all-at-once.)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00452" /><CodeLine lineNumber="452" lineLink="#ae7004860c25afdef231d29688cfdb2ff"><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/lib/support/blake3/blake3-impl-h/#a2eb6f9e0395b47b8d5e3eeae4fe0c116">INLINE</a> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="#ae7004860c25afdef231d29688cfdb2ff">hasher&#95;push&#95;cv</a>(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/lib/support/blake3/llvm-blake3-prefix-h/#a720ce7ad2dc122aeb214c6a5d4731f46">blake3&#95;hasher</a> &#42;self, uint8&#95;t new&#95;cv&#91;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/lib/support/blake3/llvm-blake3-prefix-h/#a54e230beb5e1d501702361fb91f399f0">BLAKE3&#95;OUT&#95;LEN</a>&#93;,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00453" /><CodeLine lineNumber="453"><span class="doxyHighlight">                           uint64&#95;t chunk&#95;counter) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00454" /><CodeLine lineNumber="454"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="#a63183e27546bc2e072233e0268400e83">hasher&#95;merge&#95;cv&#95;stack</a>(self, chunk&#95;counter);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00455" /><CodeLine lineNumber="455"><span class="doxyHighlight">  memcpy(&amp;self-&gt;cv&#95;stack&#91;self-&gt;cv&#95;stack&#95;len &#42; <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/lib/support/blake3/llvm-blake3-prefix-h/#a54e230beb5e1d501702361fb91f399f0">BLAKE3&#95;OUT&#95;LEN</a>&#93;, new&#95;cv,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00456" /><CodeLine lineNumber="456"><span class="doxyHighlight">         <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/lib/support/blake3/llvm-blake3-prefix-h/#a54e230beb5e1d501702361fb91f399f0">BLAKE3&#95;OUT&#95;LEN</a>);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00457" /><CodeLine lineNumber="457"><span class="doxyHighlight">  self-&gt;cv&#95;stack&#95;len += 1;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00458" /><CodeLine lineNumber="458"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00459" /><CodeLine lineNumber="459"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00460" /><CodeLine lineNumber="460" lineLink="#a63f3b0c97048b549ce37f5e6a4da701d"><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="#a63f3b0c97048b549ce37f5e6a4da701d">llvm&#95;blake3&#95;hasher&#95;update</a>(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/lib/support/blake3/llvm-blake3-prefix-h/#a720ce7ad2dc122aeb214c6a5d4731f46">blake3&#95;hasher</a> &#42;self, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &#42;input,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00461" /><CodeLine lineNumber="461"><span class="doxyHighlight">                          </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">size&#95;t</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> input&#95;len) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00462" /><CodeLine lineNumber="462"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Explicitly checking for zero avoids causing UB by passing a null pointer</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00463" /><CodeLine lineNumber="463"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// to memcpy. This comes up in practice with things like:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00464" /><CodeLine lineNumber="464"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   std::vector&lt;uint8&#95;t&gt; v;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00465" /><CodeLine lineNumber="465"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   blake3&#95;hasher&#95;update(&amp;hasher, v.data(), v.size());</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00466" /><CodeLine lineNumber="466"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (input&#95;len == 0) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00467" /><CodeLine lineNumber="467"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00468" /><CodeLine lineNumber="468"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00469" /><CodeLine lineNumber="469"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00470" /><CodeLine lineNumber="470"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> uint8&#95;t &#42;input&#95;bytes = (</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> uint8&#95;t &#42;)input;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00471" /><CodeLine lineNumber="471"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00472" /><CodeLine lineNumber="472"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// If we have some partial chunk bytes in the internal chunk&#95;state, we need</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00473" /><CodeLine lineNumber="473"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// to finish that chunk first.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00474" /><CodeLine lineNumber="474"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (<a href="#a2c1ba208c88f9efdc6702769ecd006da">chunk&#95;state&#95;len</a>(&amp;self-&gt;chunk) &gt; 0) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00475" /><CodeLine lineNumber="475"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">size&#95;t</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> take = <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/lib/support/blake3/llvm-blake3-prefix-h/#abcc4f732a672ef43bbfd2dc707e4d15e">BLAKE3&#95;CHUNK&#95;LEN</a> - <a href="#a2c1ba208c88f9efdc6702769ecd006da">chunk&#95;state&#95;len</a>(&amp;self-&gt;chunk);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00476" /><CodeLine lineNumber="476"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (take &gt; input&#95;len) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00477" /><CodeLine lineNumber="477"><span class="doxyHighlight">      take = input&#95;len;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00478" /><CodeLine lineNumber="478"><span class="doxyHighlight">    &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00479" /><CodeLine lineNumber="479"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="#a1c4270490e141bac2a6053af9ef01f6b">chunk&#95;state&#95;update</a>(&amp;self-&gt;chunk, input&#95;bytes, take);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00480" /><CodeLine lineNumber="480"><span class="doxyHighlight">    input&#95;bytes += take;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00481" /><CodeLine lineNumber="481"><span class="doxyHighlight">    input&#95;len -= take;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00482" /><CodeLine lineNumber="482"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// If we&#39;ve filled the current chunk and there&#39;s more coming, finalize this</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00483" /><CodeLine lineNumber="483"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// chunk and proceed. In this case we know it&#39;s not the root.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00484" /><CodeLine lineNumber="484"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (input&#95;len &gt; 0) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00485" /><CodeLine lineNumber="485"><span class="doxyHighlight">      <a href="/docs/api/structs/output-t">output&#95;t</a> output = <a href="#acc3e5ba813b5fb930b49c67f1edadf41">chunk&#95;state&#95;output</a>(&amp;self-&gt;chunk);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00486" /><CodeLine lineNumber="486"><span class="doxyHighlight">      uint8&#95;t chunk&#95;cv&#91;32&#93;;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00487" /><CodeLine lineNumber="487"><span class="doxyHighlight">      <a href="#a92376f69320e66a51477df2b47088249">output&#95;chaining&#95;value</a>(&amp;output, chunk&#95;cv);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00488" /><CodeLine lineNumber="488"><span class="doxyHighlight">      <a href="#ae7004860c25afdef231d29688cfdb2ff">hasher&#95;push&#95;cv</a>(self, chunk&#95;cv, self-&gt;chunk.chunk&#95;counter);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00489" /><CodeLine lineNumber="489"><span class="doxyHighlight">      <a href="#ac3fec0f8016731502a8a1ad30cea4f3d">chunk&#95;state&#95;reset</a>(&amp;self-&gt;chunk, self-&gt;key, self-&gt;chunk.chunk&#95;counter + 1);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00490" /><CodeLine lineNumber="490"><span class="doxyHighlight">    &#125; </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">else</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00491" /><CodeLine lineNumber="491"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00492" /><CodeLine lineNumber="492"><span class="doxyHighlight">    &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00493" /><CodeLine lineNumber="493"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00494" /><CodeLine lineNumber="494"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00495" /><CodeLine lineNumber="495"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Now the chunk&#95;state is clear, and we have more input. If there&#39;s more than</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00496" /><CodeLine lineNumber="496"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// a single chunk (so, definitely not the root chunk), hash the largest whole</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00497" /><CodeLine lineNumber="497"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// subtree we can, with the full benefits of SIMD (and maybe in the future,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00498" /><CodeLine lineNumber="498"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// multi-threading) parallelism. Two restrictions:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00499" /><CodeLine lineNumber="499"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// - The subtree has to be a power-of-2 number of chunks. Only subtrees along</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00500" /><CodeLine lineNumber="500"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   the right edge can be incomplete, and we don&#39;t know where the right edge</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00501" /><CodeLine lineNumber="501"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   is going to be until we get to finalize().</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00502" /><CodeLine lineNumber="502"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// - The subtree must evenly divide the total number of chunks up until this</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00503" /><CodeLine lineNumber="503"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   point (if total is not 0). If the current incomplete subtree is only</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00504" /><CodeLine lineNumber="504"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   waiting for 1 more chunk, we can&#39;t hash a subtree of 4 chunks. We have</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00505" /><CodeLine lineNumber="505"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   to complete the current subtree first.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00506" /><CodeLine lineNumber="506"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Because we might need to break up the input to form powers of 2, or to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00507" /><CodeLine lineNumber="507"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// evenly divide what we already have, this part runs in a loop.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00508" /><CodeLine lineNumber="508"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">while</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (input&#95;len &gt; <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/lib/support/blake3/llvm-blake3-prefix-h/#abcc4f732a672ef43bbfd2dc707e4d15e">BLAKE3&#95;CHUNK&#95;LEN</a>) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00509" /><CodeLine lineNumber="509"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">size&#95;t</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> subtree&#95;len = <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/lib/support/blake3/blake3-impl-h/#aa512c33323d4cb6599016c57337832fe">round&#95;down&#95;to&#95;power&#95;of&#95;2</a>(input&#95;len);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00510" /><CodeLine lineNumber="510"><span class="doxyHighlight">    uint64&#95;t count&#95;so&#95;far = self-&gt;chunk.chunk&#95;counter &#42; <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/lib/support/blake3/llvm-blake3-prefix-h/#abcc4f732a672ef43bbfd2dc707e4d15e">BLAKE3&#95;CHUNK&#95;LEN</a>;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00511" /><CodeLine lineNumber="511"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Shrink the subtree&#95;len until it evenly divides the count so far. We know</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00512" /><CodeLine lineNumber="512"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// that subtree&#95;len itself is a power of 2, so we can use a bitmasking</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00513" /><CodeLine lineNumber="513"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// trick instead of an actual remainder operation. (Note that if the caller</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00514" /><CodeLine lineNumber="514"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// consistently passes power-of-2 inputs of the same size, as is hopefully</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00515" /><CodeLine lineNumber="515"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// typical, this loop condition will always fail, and subtree&#95;len will</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00516" /><CodeLine lineNumber="516"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// always be the full length of the input.)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00517" /><CodeLine lineNumber="517"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00518" /><CodeLine lineNumber="518"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// An aside: We don&#39;t have to shrink subtree&#95;len quite this much. For</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00519" /><CodeLine lineNumber="519"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// example, if count&#95;so&#95;far is 1, we could pass 2 chunks to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00520" /><CodeLine lineNumber="520"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// compress&#95;subtree&#95;to&#95;parent&#95;node. Since we&#39;ll get 2 CVs back, we&#39;ll still</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00521" /><CodeLine lineNumber="521"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// get the right answer in the end, and we might get to use 2-way SIMD</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00522" /><CodeLine lineNumber="522"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// parallelism. The problem with this optimization, is that it gets us</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00523" /><CodeLine lineNumber="523"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// stuck always hashing 2 chunks. The total number of chunks will remain</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00524" /><CodeLine lineNumber="524"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// odd, and we&#39;ll never graduate to higher degrees of parallelism. See</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00525" /><CodeLine lineNumber="525"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// https://github.com/BLAKE3-team/BLAKE3/issues/69.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00526" /><CodeLine lineNumber="526"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">while</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> ((((uint64&#95;t)(subtree&#95;len - 1)) &amp; count&#95;so&#95;far) != 0) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00527" /><CodeLine lineNumber="527"><span class="doxyHighlight">      subtree&#95;len /= 2;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00528" /><CodeLine lineNumber="528"><span class="doxyHighlight">    &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00529" /><CodeLine lineNumber="529"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The shrunken subtree&#95;len might now be 1 chunk long. If so, hash that one</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00530" /><CodeLine lineNumber="530"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// chunk by itself. Otherwise, compress the subtree into a pair of CVs.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00531" /><CodeLine lineNumber="531"><span class="doxyHighlight">    uint64&#95;t subtree&#95;chunks = subtree&#95;len / <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/lib/support/blake3/llvm-blake3-prefix-h/#abcc4f732a672ef43bbfd2dc707e4d15e">BLAKE3&#95;CHUNK&#95;LEN</a>;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00532" /><CodeLine lineNumber="532"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (subtree&#95;len &lt;= <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/lib/support/blake3/llvm-blake3-prefix-h/#abcc4f732a672ef43bbfd2dc707e4d15e">BLAKE3&#95;CHUNK&#95;LEN</a>) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00533" /><CodeLine lineNumber="533"><span class="doxyHighlight">      <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/lib/support/blake3/llvm-blake3-prefix-h/#aed21153389299a4d7f8effa38ba58f3b">blake3&#95;chunk&#95;state</a> chunk&#95;state;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00534" /><CodeLine lineNumber="534"><span class="doxyHighlight">      <a href="#a4db94e2dcf16f8659a69b1636897baeb">chunk&#95;state&#95;init</a>(&amp;chunk&#95;state, self-&gt;key, self-&gt;chunk.flags);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00535" /><CodeLine lineNumber="535"><span class="doxyHighlight">      chunk&#95;state.chunk&#95;counter = self-&gt;chunk.chunk&#95;counter;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00536" /><CodeLine lineNumber="536"><span class="doxyHighlight">      <a href="#a1c4270490e141bac2a6053af9ef01f6b">chunk&#95;state&#95;update</a>(&amp;chunk&#95;state, input&#95;bytes, subtree&#95;len);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00537" /><CodeLine lineNumber="537"><span class="doxyHighlight">      <a href="/docs/api/structs/output-t">output&#95;t</a> output = <a href="#acc3e5ba813b5fb930b49c67f1edadf41">chunk&#95;state&#95;output</a>(&amp;chunk&#95;state);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00538" /><CodeLine lineNumber="538"><span class="doxyHighlight">      uint8&#95;t cv&#91;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/lib/support/blake3/llvm-blake3-prefix-h/#a54e230beb5e1d501702361fb91f399f0">BLAKE3&#95;OUT&#95;LEN</a>&#93;;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00539" /><CodeLine lineNumber="539"><span class="doxyHighlight">      <a href="#a92376f69320e66a51477df2b47088249">output&#95;chaining&#95;value</a>(&amp;output, cv);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00540" /><CodeLine lineNumber="540"><span class="doxyHighlight">      <a href="#ae7004860c25afdef231d29688cfdb2ff">hasher&#95;push&#95;cv</a>(self, cv, chunk&#95;state.chunk&#95;counter);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00541" /><CodeLine lineNumber="541"><span class="doxyHighlight">    &#125; </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">else</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00542" /><CodeLine lineNumber="542"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// This is the high-performance happy path, though getting here depends</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00543" /><CodeLine lineNumber="543"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// on the caller giving us a long enough input.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00544" /><CodeLine lineNumber="544"><span class="doxyHighlight">      uint8&#95;t cv&#95;pair&#91;2 &#42; <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/lib/support/blake3/llvm-blake3-prefix-h/#a54e230beb5e1d501702361fb91f399f0">BLAKE3&#95;OUT&#95;LEN</a>&#93;;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00545" /><CodeLine lineNumber="545"><span class="doxyHighlight">      <a href="#abd0aa960e3f0e3ebab8baccea1f3808a">compress&#95;subtree&#95;to&#95;parent&#95;node</a>(input&#95;bytes, subtree&#95;len, self-&gt;key,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00546" /><CodeLine lineNumber="546"><span class="doxyHighlight">                                      self-&gt;chunk.chunk&#95;counter,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00547" /><CodeLine lineNumber="547"><span class="doxyHighlight">                                      self-&gt;chunk.flags, cv&#95;pair);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00548" /><CodeLine lineNumber="548"><span class="doxyHighlight">      <a href="#ae7004860c25afdef231d29688cfdb2ff">hasher&#95;push&#95;cv</a>(self, cv&#95;pair, self-&gt;chunk.chunk&#95;counter);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00549" /><CodeLine lineNumber="549"><span class="doxyHighlight">      <a href="#ae7004860c25afdef231d29688cfdb2ff">hasher&#95;push&#95;cv</a>(self, &amp;cv&#95;pair&#91;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/lib/support/blake3/llvm-blake3-prefix-h/#a54e230beb5e1d501702361fb91f399f0">BLAKE3&#95;OUT&#95;LEN</a>&#93;,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00550" /><CodeLine lineNumber="550"><span class="doxyHighlight">                     self-&gt;chunk.chunk&#95;counter + (subtree&#95;chunks / 2));</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00551" /><CodeLine lineNumber="551"><span class="doxyHighlight">    &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00552" /><CodeLine lineNumber="552"><span class="doxyHighlight">    self-&gt;chunk.chunk&#95;counter += subtree&#95;chunks;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00553" /><CodeLine lineNumber="553"><span class="doxyHighlight">    input&#95;bytes += subtree&#95;len;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00554" /><CodeLine lineNumber="554"><span class="doxyHighlight">    input&#95;len -= subtree&#95;len;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00555" /><CodeLine lineNumber="555"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00556" /><CodeLine lineNumber="556"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00557" /><CodeLine lineNumber="557"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// If there&#39;s any remaining input less than a full chunk, add it to the chunk</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00558" /><CodeLine lineNumber="558"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// state. In that case, also do a final merge loop to make sure the subtree</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00559" /><CodeLine lineNumber="559"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// stack doesn&#39;t contain any unmerged pairs. The remaining input means we</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00560" /><CodeLine lineNumber="560"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// know these merges are non-root. This merge loop isn&#39;t strictly necessary</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00561" /><CodeLine lineNumber="561"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// here, because hasher&#95;push&#95;chunk&#95;cv already does its own merge loop, but it</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00562" /><CodeLine lineNumber="562"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// simplifies blake3&#95;hasher&#95;finalize below.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00563" /><CodeLine lineNumber="563"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (input&#95;len &gt; 0) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00564" /><CodeLine lineNumber="564"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="#a1c4270490e141bac2a6053af9ef01f6b">chunk&#95;state&#95;update</a>(&amp;self-&gt;chunk, input&#95;bytes, input&#95;len);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00565" /><CodeLine lineNumber="565"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="#a63183e27546bc2e072233e0268400e83">hasher&#95;merge&#95;cv&#95;stack</a>(self, self-&gt;chunk.chunk&#95;counter);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00566" /><CodeLine lineNumber="566"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00567" /><CodeLine lineNumber="567"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00568" /><CodeLine lineNumber="568"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00569" /><CodeLine lineNumber="569" lineLink="#a6f1551c11ac8a08c294ee4bf7bf08623"><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="#a6f1551c11ac8a08c294ee4bf7bf08623">llvm&#95;blake3&#95;hasher&#95;finalize</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/lib/support/blake3/llvm-blake3-prefix-h/#a720ce7ad2dc122aeb214c6a5d4731f46">blake3&#95;hasher</a> &#42;self, uint8&#95;t &#42;out,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00570" /><CodeLine lineNumber="570"><span class="doxyHighlight">                            </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">size&#95;t</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> out&#95;len) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00571" /><CodeLine lineNumber="571"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="#ab6b397feba4ec3af8a0b09c3d7c5bffb">llvm&#95;blake3&#95;hasher&#95;finalize&#95;seek</a>(self, 0, out, out&#95;len);</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00578" /><CodeLine lineNumber="578" lineLink="#ab6b397feba4ec3af8a0b09c3d7c5bffb"><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="#ab6b397feba4ec3af8a0b09c3d7c5bffb">llvm&#95;blake3&#95;hasher&#95;finalize&#95;seek</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/lib/support/blake3/llvm-blake3-prefix-h/#a720ce7ad2dc122aeb214c6a5d4731f46">blake3&#95;hasher</a> &#42;self, uint64&#95;t seek,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00579" /><CodeLine lineNumber="579"><span class="doxyHighlight">                                 uint8&#95;t &#42;out, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">size&#95;t</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> out&#95;len) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00580" /><CodeLine lineNumber="580"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Explicitly checking for zero avoids causing UB by passing a null pointer</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00581" /><CodeLine lineNumber="581"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// to memcpy. This comes up in practice with things like:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00582" /><CodeLine lineNumber="582"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   std::vector&lt;uint8&#95;t&gt; v;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00583" /><CodeLine lineNumber="583"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   blake3&#95;hasher&#95;finalize(&amp;hasher, v.data(), v.size());</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00584" /><CodeLine lineNumber="584"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (out&#95;len == 0) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00585" /><CodeLine lineNumber="585"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00586" /><CodeLine lineNumber="586"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00587" /><CodeLine lineNumber="587"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00588" /><CodeLine lineNumber="588"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// If the subtree stack is empty, then the current chunk is the root.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00589" /><CodeLine lineNumber="589"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (self-&gt;cv&#95;stack&#95;len == 0) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00590" /><CodeLine lineNumber="590"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/structs/output-t">output&#95;t</a> output = <a href="#acc3e5ba813b5fb930b49c67f1edadf41">chunk&#95;state&#95;output</a>(&amp;self-&gt;chunk);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00591" /><CodeLine lineNumber="591"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="#a0a194eae24fe95b572091dc7e992744f">output&#95;root&#95;bytes</a>(&amp;output, seek, out, out&#95;len);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00592" /><CodeLine lineNumber="592"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00593" /><CodeLine lineNumber="593"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00594" /><CodeLine lineNumber="594"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// If there are any bytes in the chunk state, finalize that chunk and do a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00595" /><CodeLine lineNumber="595"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// roll-up merge between that chunk hash and every subtree in the stack. In</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00596" /><CodeLine lineNumber="596"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// this case, the extra merge loop at the end of blake3&#95;hasher&#95;update</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00597" /><CodeLine lineNumber="597"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// guarantees that none of the subtrees in the stack need to be merged with</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00598" /><CodeLine lineNumber="598"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// each other first. Otherwise, if there are no bytes in the chunk state,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00599" /><CodeLine lineNumber="599"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// then the top of the stack is a chunk hash, and we start the merge from</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00600" /><CodeLine lineNumber="600"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// that.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00601" /><CodeLine lineNumber="601"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/structs/output-t">output&#95;t</a> output;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00602" /><CodeLine lineNumber="602"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">size&#95;t</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> cvs&#95;remaining;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00603" /><CodeLine lineNumber="603"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (<a href="#a2c1ba208c88f9efdc6702769ecd006da">chunk&#95;state&#95;len</a>(&amp;self-&gt;chunk) &gt; 0) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00604" /><CodeLine lineNumber="604"><span class="doxyHighlight">    cvs&#95;remaining = self-&gt;cv&#95;stack&#95;len;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00605" /><CodeLine lineNumber="605"><span class="doxyHighlight">    output = <a href="#acc3e5ba813b5fb930b49c67f1edadf41">chunk&#95;state&#95;output</a>(&amp;self-&gt;chunk);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00606" /><CodeLine lineNumber="606"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125; </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">else</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00607" /><CodeLine lineNumber="607"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// There are always at least 2 CVs in the stack in this case.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00608" /><CodeLine lineNumber="608"><span class="doxyHighlight">    cvs&#95;remaining = self-&gt;cv&#95;stack&#95;len - 2;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00609" /><CodeLine lineNumber="609"><span class="doxyHighlight">    output = <a href="#ab18874614dade172d2726abc3e88d480">parent&#95;output</a>(&amp;self-&gt;cv&#95;stack&#91;cvs&#95;remaining &#42; 32&#93;, self-&gt;key,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00610" /><CodeLine lineNumber="610"><span class="doxyHighlight">                           self-&gt;chunk.flags);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00611" /><CodeLine lineNumber="611"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00612" /><CodeLine lineNumber="612"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">while</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (cvs&#95;remaining &gt; 0) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00613" /><CodeLine lineNumber="613"><span class="doxyHighlight">    cvs&#95;remaining -= 1;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00614" /><CodeLine lineNumber="614"><span class="doxyHighlight">    uint8&#95;t parent&#95;block&#91;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/lib/support/blake3/llvm-blake3-prefix-h/#a304cb82e31ff3dc5a4b02f7fce75555e">BLAKE3&#95;BLOCK&#95;LEN</a>&#93;;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00615" /><CodeLine lineNumber="615"><span class="doxyHighlight">    memcpy(parent&#95;block, &amp;self-&gt;cv&#95;stack&#91;cvs&#95;remaining &#42; 32&#93;, 32);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00616" /><CodeLine lineNumber="616"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="#a92376f69320e66a51477df2b47088249">output&#95;chaining&#95;value</a>(&amp;output, &amp;parent&#95;block&#91;32&#93;);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00617" /><CodeLine lineNumber="617"><span class="doxyHighlight">    output = <a href="#ab18874614dade172d2726abc3e88d480">parent&#95;output</a>(parent&#95;block, self-&gt;key, self-&gt;chunk.flags);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00618" /><CodeLine lineNumber="618"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00619" /><CodeLine lineNumber="619"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="#a0a194eae24fe95b572091dc7e992744f">output&#95;root&#95;bytes</a>(&amp;output, seek, out, out&#95;len);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00620" /><CodeLine lineNumber="620"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;</span></CodeLine>
